title: Median Wage Impact from AI by 2030
description: Projected change in real median wages in the US due to AI adoption, combining productivity gains and displacement effects.

overlays.label: Indeed: AI-exposed wages grew 1.2% vs 4.1% non-exposed
Walmart: AI checkout reducing staffing ~8% per location
UPS: 12K jobs cut, remaining driver wages +2.5%
Korinek & Stiglitz: wage growth requires capital-augmenting AI
Stanford: small positive wage effects in AI-exposed jobs
Goldman Sachs: AI to raise labor productivity ~15% when fully adopted
QJE: AI assistance increases worker productivity by 15% on average
Brynjolfsson: US productivity grew 2.7% in 2025, nearly double the decade average

sources.title: AI and the US Labor Market
Global Wage Report 2022-23: The impact of inflation and COVID-19 on wages and purchasing power
AI Will Transform the Global Economy. Let's Make Sure It Benefits Humanity
sources.excerpt: In most scenarios, AI will likely worsen overall inequality. Higher-income workers may see disproportionate wage gains.

sources.title: The Impact of Artificial Intelligence on the Labor Market
sources.excerpt: AI exposure is concentrated among high-skill, high-wage occupations, but wage effects may cascade downward.

sources.title: AI could be coming for higher-paid workers this time
Employment Cost Index — 2025 Q1
The Wage Compression that Persisted
State of Working America: AI and Wage Trends
Walmart 2024 10-K — Automation Investment & Wage Strategy
sources.excerpt: Walmart raised minimum wage to $15/hr but disclosed AI-driven checkout and inventory systems reducing total store staffing needs by ~8% per location.

sources.title: US Wage Tracker — Posted Wage Trends by Occupation
sources.excerpt: Posted wages for AI-exposed occupations (admin, data entry, basic accounting) grew 1.2% YoY vs. 4.1% for non-AI-exposed roles, suggesting wage suppression.

sources.title: UPS Q4 2024 Earnings — AI Logistics & Workforce Restructuring
sources.excerpt: UPS cut 12,000 jobs in 2024 citing AI-optimized routing and automated package sorting. Remaining driver wages increased 2.5% under new contract.

sources.title: PwC Global AI Jobs Barometer 2025
sources.excerpt: AI-skilled workers command a 56% wage premium, up from 25% in prior year. AI roles median compensation at $157K vs. $49,500 all-occupation median.

sources.title: BLS Occupational Employment and Wage Statistics, May 2024
sources.excerpt: Median annual wage for all occupations: $49,500. AI-exposed administrative and clerical wages grew 1.1% vs. 3.8% for non-AI-exposed occupations.

sources.title: Economic Growth under Transformative AI
sources.publisher: Annual Review of Economics / NBER (Korinek, Trammell)
sources.excerpt: Sufficiently advanced AI could dramatically raise growth rates and lower labor share, breaking Kaldor Facts. Wages may rise or fall depending on returns to scale and direction of technical change.

sources.title: Power and Progress: Our Thousand-Year Struggle Over Technology and Prosperity
sources.excerpt: Technology does not automatically benefit workers; shared prosperity requires deliberate policy choices. AI could follow historical pattern of concentrating gains among capital owners.

sources.title: Steering Technological Progress
sources.excerpt: For the empirically plausible case that capital and labor are gross complements, raising wages requires capital-augmenting innovation rather than labor-augmenting.

sources.title: How Will AI Affect the Global Workforce?
sources.excerpt: Generative AI will raise the level of labor productivity in the US and other developed markets by around 15% when fully adopted and incorporated into regular production.

sources.title: Generative AI at Work
sources.excerpt: Access to AI assistance increases worker productivity, as measured by issues resolved per hour, by 15% on average, with substantial heterogeneity across workers.

sources.title: US Productivity Growth and AI
sources.excerpt: US productivity grew roughly 2.7% in 2025, nearly double the 1.4% annual average of the past decade — a decoupling of output from labor input that is the hallmark of productivity growth.

sources.title: AI, Productivity, and Labor Markets: A Review of the Empirical Evidence
sources.excerpt: Small but statistically significant positive wage effects found across AI-exposed occupations; 35.9% of US workers used generative AI by December 2025.

sources.title: Labor Market Effects of Generative AI
sources.excerpt: Small positive wage effects identified for workers in AI-exposed occupations; adoption concentrated among younger, college-educated, higher-earning employees.
